source.description: Customer name/address file with some non-ASCII characters..

test-case.name: NodeTest003
test-case.description: Simple test for * node test

test-case.name: NodeTest004
test-case.description: Simple test for . node test

test-case.name: NodeTest005
test-case.description: Simple test for . and * node test

test-case.name: nametest-1
test-case.description: Name test that evaluates a child "b" of a newly construted node.

test-case.name: nametest-2
test-case.description: Name test that test for "child::b" of a newly construted node.

test-case.name: nametest-3
test-case.description: Name test that uses an unknown prefix.

test-case.name: nametest-4
test-case.description: Name test that uses an unknown prefix. Uses "*".

test-case.name: nametest-5
test-case.description: Name test that examines "*:b" for a newly constructed element.

test-case.name: nametest-6
test-case.description: Name test that examines "ns1:b" for a newly constructed element that uses a declared namespace.
test-case.test: declare namespace ns1 = "http://example.org"; let $var := context2 return $var/child::ns1:b

test-case.name: nametest-7
test-case.description: Name test that examines "b" for a newly constructed element.

test-case.name: nametest-8
test-case.description: Name test that examines "b" for a newly constructed element and used as argument to "node-name".

test-case.name: nametest-9
test-case.description: Name test that attempts to select non-existent nodes from a newly constructed. Use fn:count to avoid empty file.

test-case.name: nametest-10
test-case.description: Name test that selects an "child::b" of a newly created element node and whose namespace URI is declared as the default namespace.
test-case.test: declare default element namespace "http://www.example.org/examples"; let $var := context2 return fn:namespace-uri(exactly-one($var/child::b))

test-case.name: nametest-11
test-case.description: Name test that selects an "child::b" of a newly created element node and whose namespace URI is in no namespace.

test-case.name: nametest-12
test-case.description: Name test that selects an "child::*:day" of an element node used as part of an union operation.

test-case.name: nametest-13
test-case.description: Name test that selects an "child::*" and "child::day" (same nodes) of an element node used as part of an intersect operation.

test-case.name: nametest-14
test-case.description: Name test that selects an "child::*" and "child::day" (same nodes) of an element node used as part of an except operation. Use fn:count to avoid empty file.

test-case.name: nametest-15
test-case.description: Name test that selects all the children of the context node with "child::*".

test-case.name: nametest-16
test-case.description: Name test that selects all the children of the context node with "child::employee".

test-case.name: nametest-17
test-case.description: Name test that selects all the children of the context node with "child::*:employee".

test-case.name: nametest-18
test-case.description: Evaluation of a name test, which selects a child that was created using a declared namespace (qualified name). Use "child::*:b" syntax.
test-case.test: declare namespace ns1 = "http://example.org"; let $var := context2 return $var/child::*:b

test-case.name: nametest-19
test-case.description: Nametest using Q{uri}local syntax

test-case.name: nametest-20
test-case.description: Nametest using Q{}local syntax

test-case.name: nametest-21
test-case.description: Nametest using Q{uri}* syntax

test-case.name: nametest-22
test-case.description: Nametest using Q{}* syntax

test-case.name: nametest-23
test-case.description: Nametest using malformed Q{}:* syntax

test-case.name: K-NameTest-1
test-case.description: A nodetest appearing in a wrong place, leading to syntax error.

test-case.name: K-NameTest-2
test-case.description: '---..---' is an invalid nodetest.

test-case.name: K-NameTest-3
test-case.description: 'foo-' is an invalid nametest. Whitespace is wrong.

test-case.name: K-NameTest-4
test-case.description: 'nametest : nametest' is a syntactically invalid expression.

test-case.name: K-NameTest-5
test-case.description: 'nametest: nametest' is a syntactically invalid expression.

test-case.name: K-NameTest-6
test-case.description: 'nametest :nametest' is a syntactically invalid expression.

test-case.name: K-NameTest-7
test-case.description: Invalid string literals and nametests mixed, stressing tokenizer and parser code.

test-case.name: K-NameTest-8
test-case.description: Invalid string literals and nametests mixed, stressing tokenizer and parser code.

test-case.name: K-NameTest-9
test-case.description: Invalid string literals and nametests mixed, stressing tokenizer and parser code.

test-case.name: K-NameTest-10
test-case.description: Invalid string literals and nametests mixed, stressing tokenizer and parser code.

test-case.name: K-NameTest-11
test-case.description: Invalid string literals and nametests mixed, stressing tokenizer and parser code.

test-case.name: K2-NameTest-1
test-case.description: "//" by itself is not a valid path expression.

test-case.name: K2-NameTest-2
test-case.description: "/*5" is a syntax error.

test-case.name: K2-NameTest-3
test-case.description: "/*5" is a syntax error.

test-case.name: K2-NameTest-4
test-case.description: "4 + / * 5" is a syntax error.

test-case.name: K2-NameTest-5
test-case.description: A complex expression to parse, taken from W3C's (obsolete) 'Building a Tokenizer for XPath or XQuery' document. The query naturally contains XPTY0004. XPDY0002 is allowed since an implementation may change the default focus from being 'none' to being undefined.
test-case.test: declare namespace namespace = "http://example.com"; declare union <union>for gibberish { for $for in for return <for>***div div</for> }</union>, if(if) then then else else- +-++-**-* instance of element(*)* * * **---++div- div -div

test-case.name: K2-NameTest-6
test-case.description: An axis must be specified when ".." is used.

test-case.name: K2-NameTest-7
test-case.description: An axis must be specified when ".." is used(#2).

test-case.name: K2-NameTest-8
test-case.description: "@" by itself is syntactically invalid.

test-case.name: K2-NameTest-9
test-case.description: "@" with space is syntactically invalid.

test-case.name: K2-NameTest-10
test-case.description: A node test must follow "parent::" is used.

test-case.name: K2-NameTest-11
test-case.description: No binding existing for a "prefix:*" test.

test-case.name: K2-NameTest-12
test-case.description: A nametest being "xml:space".

test-case.name: K2-NameTest-13
test-case.description: A nametest being "xml:*".

test-case.name: K2-NameTest-14
test-case.description: A nametest being "child::*".
test-case.test: declare variable $var := <elem>text<a/><!-- a comment --><b/><?target data?><c/><![CDATA[more text]]></elem>; $var/child::*

test-case.name: K2-NameTest-15
test-case.description: A name test matching many different kinds of nodes.

test-case.name: K2-NameTest-16
test-case.description: A wild-card name test matching only elements.

test-case.name: K2-NameTest-17
test-case.description: A name test matching only attributes.

test-case.name: K2-NameTest-18
test-case.description: A wild-card name test matching only attributes.

test-case.name: K2-NameTest-19
test-case.description: A name test matching only processing-instructions.

test-case.name: K2-NameTest-20
test-case.description: A wild-card name test matching only processing-instructions.

test-case.name: K2-NameTest-21
test-case.description: A processing-instruction() with an invalid NCName in a string literal. Note: Test case is not representable in XQueryX

test-case.name: K2-NameTest-22
test-case.description: A processing-instruction() with an invalid NCName in a string literal.

test-case.name: K2-NameTest-23
test-case.description: A processing-instruction() with an invalid NCName in a string literal. Note: Test case is not representable in XQueryX

test-case.name: K2-NameTest-24
test-case.description: An integer literal cannot be specified as PI name.

test-case.name: K2-NameTest-25
test-case.description: A QName cannot be specified as PI name.

test-case.name: K2-NameTest-26
test-case.description: A variable reference cannot be specified as PI name.

test-case.name: K2-NameTest-27
test-case.description: A variable reference cannot be specified as PI name.

test-case.name: K2-NameTest-28
test-case.description: A element name cannot be a string literal, inside element().

test-case.name: K2-NameTest-29
test-case.description: A element name cannot be a string literal, inside element().

test-case.name: K2-NameTest-30
test-case.description: Namespaces are not inherited.
test-case.test: declare namespace a = "http://example.com/1"; declare namespace b = "http://example.com/2"; let $e := <e a:n1="content" b:n1="content"> <a:n1/> <b:n1/> <?n1 ?> <n1/> </e> return $e/*:n1

test-case.name: K2-NameTest-31
test-case.description: Namespaces are not inherited.
test-case.test: declare namespace a = "http://example.com/1"; declare namespace b = "http://example.com/2"; let $e := <e a:n1="content" b:n1="content"> <a:n1/> <b:n1/> <?n1 ?> <n1/> </e> return $e/a:*

test-case.name: K2-NameTest-32
test-case.description: attribute(name) as part of a step.

test-case.name: K2-NameTest-33
test-case.description: String literals aren't allowed in schema-element().

test-case.name: K2-NameTest-34
test-case.description: String literals aren't allowed in schema-attribute().

test-case.name: K2-NameTest-35
test-case.description: An undeclared prefix inside a name in schema-element() is an error. a little comment

test-case.name: K2-NameTest-36
test-case.description: An undeclared prefix inside a name in schema-attribute() is an error. a little comment

test-case.name: K2-NameTest-37
test-case.description: Specifying an unknown type in schema-element() is an error.

test-case.name: K2-NameTest-38
test-case.description: Specifying an unknown type in schema-attribute() is an error.

test-case.name: K2-NameTest-39
test-case.description: Specifying an unknown type in schema-element() is an error(with namespace).

test-case.name: K2-NameTest-40
test-case.description: Specifying an unknown type in schema-attribute() is an error(with namespace).

test-case.name: K2-NameTest-41
test-case.description: Specifying an unknown prefix raises an error.

test-case.name: K2-NameTest-42
test-case.description: Specifying an unknown prefix raises an error.

test-case.name: K2-NameTest-43
test-case.description: The prefix 'xmlns' is not in-scope.

test-case.name: K2-NameTest-44
test-case.description: The prefix 'xmlns' is not in-scope(#2).

test-case.name: K2-NameTest-45
test-case.description: The prefix 'xmlns' is not in-scope(#3).

test-case.name: K2-NameTest-46
test-case.description: The prefix 'xmlns' is not in-scope(#4).

test-case.name: K2-NameTest-47
test-case.description: Use 'xmlns' as an element name test.

test-case.name: K2-NameTest-48
test-case.description: Use 'xmlns' as an attribute name test.

test-case.name: K2-NameTest-49
test-case.description: An child axis applies on a sequence of attributes.
test-case.test: declare namespace p = "http://example.com/"; {/attribute::*/p:*}

test-case.name: K2-NameTest-50
test-case.description: A '@prefix:*'-test doesn't match element nodes.

test-case.name: K2-NameTest-51
test-case.description: Navigate the child axis of a computed attribute.

test-case.name: K2-NameTest-52
test-case.description: Navigate the child axis of a computed comment.

test-case.name: K2-NameTest-53
test-case.description: Navigate the child axis of a direct comment.

test-case.name: K2-NameTest-54
test-case.description: Navigate the child axis of a computed PI.

test-case.name: K2-NameTest-55
test-case.description: Navigate the child axis of a direct PI.

test-case.name: K2-NameTest-56
test-case.description: A '*:name' as operand to 'eq'.

test-case.name: K2-NameTest-57
test-case.description: A '@*:name' as operand to 'eq'.

test-case.name: K2-NameTest-58
test-case.description: A 'prefix:*' as operand to 'eq'.
test-case.test: declare namespace prefix = "http://example.com/"; declare variable $a := ; {$a/prefix:* eq 1}

test-case.name: K2-NameTest-59
test-case.description: A '@*prefix:*' as operand to 'eq'.
test-case.test: declare namespace prefix = "http://example.com/"; declare variable $a := ; {$a/@prefix:* eq 1}

test-case.name: K2-NameTest-60
test-case.description: Combine the descendant-or-self axis with a processing-instruction test.
test-case.test: declare variable $input := <e/>; empty(for $PI as processing-instruction() in $input//processing-instruction() return $PI)

test-case.name: K2-NameTest-61
test-case.description: Apply processing-instruction() to the empty sequence.

test-case.name: K2-NameTest-62
test-case.description: Apply processing-instruction() to the result of an element constructor.

test-case.name: K2-NameTest-63
test-case.description: Combine the descendant-or-self axis with the child axis.

test-case.name: K2-NameTest-64
test-case.description: Ensure the axis is correct when using an attribute(*, type) test in the abbreviated axis.

test-case.name: K2-NameTest-65
test-case.description: Ensure the axis is correct when using an attribute(name, type) test in the abbreviated axis.

test-case.name: K2-NameTest-66
test-case.description: Use an unbound prefix inside attribute().

test-case.name: K2-NameTest-67
test-case.description: Use an unbound prefix inside attribute()(#2).

test-case.description: Use a type with attribute() that doesn't match.

test-case.description: Use a type with attribute() that doesn't exist.

test-case.name: K2-NameTest-70
test-case.description: Use a type with attribute() that doesn't exist(#2).

test-case.name: K2-NameTest-71
test-case.description: Use a complex type with attribute().

test-case.name: K2-NameTest-72
test-case.description: Use element() with an unbound prefix.

test-case.name: K2-NameTest-73
test-case.description: Use element() with an unbound prefix(#2).

test-case.name: K2-NameTest-74
test-case.description: Use element() with a type that doesn't exist.

test-case.description: Use element() with a type that doesn't exist.

test-case.description: Use element() with xs:anyType.

test-case.name: K2-NameTest-77
test-case.description: Use element() with xs:anyType.

test-case.description: Use 'let' as a single name test.

test-case.description: Use 'for' as a single name test.

test-case.description: Use 'as' as a single name test.

test-case.description: Use 'of' as a single name test.

test-case.name: K2-NameTest-82
test-case.description: A name cannot end with a colon.

test-case.name: K2-NameTest-83
test-case.description: A name test that is equal to a node type name.

test-case.name: K2-NameTest-84
test-case.description: Axis names are reserved function names.
test-case.test: declare default function namespace "http://www.example.com/"; declare namespace e = "http://www.example.com/"; declare function element() { 1 }; e:element()

test-case.description: A single '_' is a valid name test.

test-case.description: A '_' between letters is a valid name test.

test-case.description: Use a type with attribute() that doesn't exist(#3).

test-case.description: Use a type with attribute() that doesn't exist(#4).
